title: Japan’s Male-Dominated Ruling Party Takes a Chance on a Sneaker-Wearing Young Mother
sub_head: Maiko Takahashi is running for the Liberal Democratic Party, where more than 90% of the lawmakers are men
body:
OITA, Japan—After 2½ years of preparation, Maiko Takahashi has learned what it takes to be a politician in Japan, and her big test awaits.
Wearing a sash with her name written in big letters, the 33-year-old former journalist bows down to her waist and shouts her devotion to the district she hopes to represent in Parliament. She races in sneakers around a construction company’s office parking lot, eager to fist-bump as many voters as she can, repeating in the time-honored fashion of Japanese campaigns, “Thank you! I will try hard!”
